Figure 1 offers a tentative syndemic model to guide research in this area. The right side of the model highlights the concentration of and possible interactions among COVID‐19 and two chronic conditions that seem to pose particular risks for people infected with SARS‐CoV‐2: hypertension and diabetes (Richardson et al., 2020; Yang et al., 2020). We do not yet understand why these conditions make COVID‐19 more dangerous—or even, for certain, if they do
2 —but suspected pathways for disease interactions include the renin‐angiotensin system (Kreutz et al., 2020), the endothelium (Sardu et al., 2020), and inflammatory dysregulation (Mahmudpour, Roozbeh, Keshavarz, Farrokhi, & Nabipour, 2020). Because these systems are also involved in diabetes and hypertension, researchers are pursuing the hypothesis that those conditions interact with COVID‐19 to make infection with SARS‐CoV‐2 more deadly.
